Function templates {{tt|ref}} and {{tt|cref}} are helper functions that generate an object of type {{lc|std::reference_wrapper}}, using [[cpp/language/template_argument_deduction|template argument deduction]] to determine the template argument of the result.

{{rrev|since=c++20|{{tt|T}} may be an incomplete type.}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | t | lvalue reference to object that needs to be wrapped or an instance of {{lc|std::reference_wrapper}}}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1@ {{c|std::reference_wrapper&lt;T&gt;(t)}}
@2@ {{c|t}}
@4@ {{c|std::reference_wrapper&lt;const T&gt;(t)}}
@5@ {{c|t}}
@3,6@ rvalue reference wrapper is deleted.

===Example===
{{example
 |
 | code=
#include &lt;functional&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

void f(int&amp; n1, int&amp; n2, const int&amp; n3)
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "In function: " &lt;&lt; n1 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n2 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n3 &lt;&lt; '\n';
    ++n1; // increments the copy of n1 stored in the function object
    ++n2; // increments the main()'s n2
    // ++n3; // compile error
}

int main()
{
    int n1 = 1, n2 = 2, n3 = 3;
    std::function&lt;void()&gt; bound_f = std::bind(f, n1, std::ref(n2), std::cref(n3));
    n1 = 10;
    n2 = 11;
    n3 = 12;
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "Before function: " &lt;&lt; n1 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n2 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n3 &lt;&lt; '\n';
    bound_f();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "After function: " &lt;&lt; n1 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n2 &lt;&lt; ' ' &lt;&lt; n3 &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
 | output=
Before function: 10 11 12
In function: 1 11 12
After function: 10 12 12
}}
